messages.title: How we can change the future together

keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP wants a FAIRER Australian-style points-based system to decide who comes to work and settle here.
UKIP will pour £3 billion a year EXTRA into the NHS to keep it as a free public service, funded by scrapping our £55 million a day EU membership fee.
UKIP will SCRAP income tax on the minimum wage, SCRAP the bedroom tax, and SCRAP the tax on your children when you die.
By stopping our EU membership fee and clawing back the £30 million a day spent on foreign aid, UKIP is the ONLY PARTY with money to spend at home.

issues.brexitEurope: Stopping our EU membership fee and clawing back the £30 million a day spent on foreign aid.
issues.economy: Investing NHS savings domestically, scrapping taxes such as the bedroom tax and tax on inheritance.
issues.environment: Concern for nature during development in rural Essex.
issues.health: Invest £3 billion a year EXTRA into the NHS.
issues.immigration: Implement a points-based system to control who comes to work and settle in the UK.
issues.socialWelfare: SCRAP income tax on the minimum wage.

leaflet.personalStatement: Over the next five years the UK could be lost forever with severe damage to the infrastructure.

contactInformation.address: 34 Evelyn Road, St. Leight's, Essex, CM3 1QJ.

images.caption: Peter Day - Standing Up for Real Change

leaflet.additionalNotes: Peter Day emphasizes his concerns for local issues such as Stansted airport, Broomfield Hospital, and protecting nature in rural Essex. He also brings up his wife Fiona and their past entertainment work.
